text:
He lay there for a long time. Sometimes he seemed to wake up, but each time he realized it was late into the night. Still, he didn’t feel like getting up. Eventually, he noticed the sky starting to lighten. He was on his back, still groggy from whatever had just happened. 

Suddenly, loud, desperate cries came from the street—sounds he recognized from every night after two o’clock. They jolted him awake.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist is overwhelmed by chaotic thoughts and feelings of despair as he lies in his room, oblivious to the passage of time.
